qas.question: When was the Company of Scotland granted a charter?
When was Panama colonized by Scotland?
How long did the Scottish Panama colony survive?
How much Scottish capital was lost in the Panama colony attempt?
When was the Treaty of Union?

context: In <a0_0>1695<a0_0/>, the Scottish Parliament granted a charter to the Company of Scotland, which established a settlement in <a1_0>1698<a1_0/> on the isthmus of Panama. Besieged by neighbouring Spanish colonists of New Granada, and afflicted by malaria, the colony was abandoned <a2_0>two years<a2_0/> later. The Darien scheme was a financial disaster for Scotland—<a3_0>a quarter<a3_0/> of Scottish capital was lost in the enterprise—and ended Scottish hopes of establishing its own overseas empire. The episode also had major political consequences, persuading the governments of both England and Scotland of the merits of a union of countries, rather than just crowns. This occurred in <a4_0>1707<a4_0/> with the Treaty of Union, establishing the Kingdom of Great Britain.
